body: Dear Mostapha and Chris, There seems to be a problem with solving the adjacencies of concentric zones. Please see the attached gh file. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/LkCkzR8kYlnjft2bKAlH2L83t7N7rOHKsYjB7ydcQwZTbxSEh1NLTVYMr9yjudt97wsXsAJTepcE94hBVtqyHHmJ6HywGJ5X/Concentric_Zones_Adjacencies_Problem_ary01.jpg) The first model (top) contains concentric zones. The adjacencies are shown as "outdoors" which is not correct.   In the second model, zones are not concentric (the core is a little bit shifted in Y direction). The adjacencies are solved correctly (surface). Is there any way to avoid the problem (e.g. by setting the code in a way that it automatically displaces the centers of concentric zones (just in calculation) without changing their surfaces' geometry)? Best, Aryan
